content: @Aaron Seib I'm finally getting to read the connectathon descriptions (as everyone on this stream noticed, I'm sure). I don't understand this sentence:
"In the Consumer Access use case the end-point is predetermined to be the application of the Consumer's choice"

Also, this sentence is confusing:
"an Authorization service uses rules from teh From the FHIR Consent resource to either satisfy a request for resources or complete a transaction where a bundle of resources are generated for transport to the designated end-point that is specific to the context of the transaction"
that's a resource server functionality piece, not an AS piece
Hi all, EMR Direct is here and we have brought our client app and server, if any other CCDE track participants would like to test with us.
...where can I find your server details?
Julie, make sure you add your details in the connectathon management application. We are using that, not the spreadsheet
btw - url for that is http://snapp.clinfhir.com:4000/

Is there interest in participating in a Consumer Centered Data Exchange track at the upcoming Connectathon? This would start with the previous tracks that were focused on consent (using either Consent and/or OAuth). Might add Accounting-of-Disclosures, or tracking of Provenance for re-disclosure control, or other features the community is interested in. See http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=January_2018_New_Orleans_CCDE_Connectathon_Track_2

Kathleen Connor and Aaron Seib are spinning this up. It's named Consumer Mediated Data Exchangeon on the wiki.
Symptomatic has the Consent and OAuth prerequisites in place and could participate.
